main.name: Kurtis Pinkney
main.description: currently employed to develop operational workflows to process weather satellite data generating meteorological products in near-real time.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: While working through my Master's degree, I developed a passion for Python by self-teaching myself the language to build upon the programming skills I gained as an undergraduate. To practice these new skills I completed all my course and thesis work using Python. I was also fortunate to work as a Graduate Teaching Assistant and to serve as the AMS club president which allowed me to develop solid mentorship and leadership skills. I was also apart of multiple field campaigns that gave me the opportunity to collaborate with scientists from various universites and organizations working to accomplish the various research objectives each party had.

education.degree: B.S. in Atmospheric Sciences; Minor in Mathematics
education.description: I stumbled into this major by accident, but I am extremely thankful for the experience it has afforded me. My coursework exposed me to C and while working as a Research Assistant I worked on multiple projects that required me to collaborate with other scientists to perform various analyses using Matlab and IDL.

work.title: Data Technician III
work.description: My primary responsibility is to develop operational workflows that process weather satellite data in near-real time utilizing scientific algorithms to generate meteorological products. I work heavily with Python and orchestrate the workflows using Argo to run on Kubernetes clusters, monitoring job statistics stored in InfluxDB and visualized on Grafana dashboards. I've worked my way into a senior position where I mentor more junior employees. Recently, I've been leading the development of multiple utility Python packages that will allow us to get rid of countless lines of duplicate code. Through these projects I've been able to introduce concepts such as unit testing and continuous integration that will be useful as our team tranisitions to a more services oriented architecture.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: I self-taught myself Python in graduate school and is the language I am most familiar with. My current position requires heavy use of Python.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I've used Git for all of my personal projects (Github) and professional work (Gitlab). I've also dabbled in some open source projects.

skills.name: Kubernetes
skills.description: I've used Kubernetes professionally to run operational workflows in near-real time orchestrating various Python modules, Docker images, and configurations settings using Argo.

skills.name: Docker
skills.description: Docker has been a useful technology for me when deploying continuous integration pipelines, orchestrating workflows on Kubernetes, and for localized testing in a simulated production environment.

skills.name: InfluxDB/Grafana
skills.description: I use the InfluxDB and Grafana stack for measuring processing statistics collected from operational workflows that are run on Kubernetes clusters.

skills.name: Jenkins
skills.description: I've recently adopted and introduced continous integration pipelines to my development team as we transition towards a DevOps centric environment.

skills.name: ReactJs
skills.description: I'm only just beginning to learn the ins and outs of React (and Javascript) and decided to build this site as a professional development project to further my skills.

skills.name: PostgreSQL
skills.description: I've recently started using PostgreSQL both locally and using AWS' RDS in a personal project as a way to gain more exposure to databases, SQL, and AWS.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
